translated: “The One with Golden Skin, the Awakened One,
was walking along the main street;
he was like a golden water pot,
At that time I was the son of a merchant,
I had placed a pāṭali flower
on my head and was carrying it.
With a mind full of joy,
I paid homage to Tissa, the one who knows the world, the protector,
I do not know of any bad destination,🔽this is the fruit of worshipping with flowers.
… the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pāṭalipupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā pāṭalipupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus have I heard: on one occasion the venerable elder Pāṭalipupphiya recited these verses.
The Elder Pāṭalipupphiya’s Birth Story, the eighth.
